channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report X-2024091111
item.description:
Report X-2024091111

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T09:21:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-10
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: LEAKING PLASTIC DRUM WAS DISCOVERED BY AN AUDITOR WHO THEN NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. ALL PPE (GLOVES GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON, SILVER LINING) WAS PUT ON AND DRUM WAS PUT INTO A YELLOW TUB/DMP BAG. DRUM WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ALL TUBS/PPE WERE THEN DECONTAMINATED AND DRUM WAS FURTHER PROCESSED INTO ETT.

item.title: Report X-2024090713
item.description:
Report X-2024090713

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-07
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 6th during the PM sort a box was found that was wet and was compromised. The inside packages were viewable from the water damage and there were two packages inside of the outer package both of them marked as Class 2.2 and Class 5.1 and contained UN1070, Nitrous Oxide, 2.2(5.1). There were no markings on the outside of the outer package to indicate dangerous goods were inside. The packge has been placed inside of a steel salvage drum and is being held pending disposition.
